contracts.title: CVE connector
contracts.description: The OpenCTI CVE connector is a software component designed to automatically import information about Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVEs) into the OpenCTI platform
contracts.short_description: Collecting and updating CVE data in OpenCTI

OPENCTI_TOKEN.description: The token of the user who represents the connector in the OpenCTI platform.

CONNECTOR_TYPE.description: Should always be set to EXTERNAL_IMPORT for this connector.

CONNECTOR_LOG_LEVEL.description: Determines the verbosity of the logs.

CONNECTOR_DURATION_PERIOD.description: Duration between two scheduled runs of the connector (ISO 8601 format).

CONNECTOR_ID.description: A unique UUIDv4 identifier for this connector instance.

CONNECTOR_SCOPE.description: The scope or type of data the connector is importing, either a MIME type or Stix Object (for information only).

CONNECTOR_QUEUE_THRESHOLD.description: Connector queue max size in Mbytes. Default to 500.

CVE_INTERVAL.description: Interval in hours to check and import new CVEs. Must be strictly greater than 1, advice from NIST minimum 2 hours.

CVE_MAX_DATE_RANGE.description: Determines how many days to collect CVE. Maximum of 120 days.

CVE_MAINTAIN_DATA.description: If set to `True`, import CVEs from the last run of the connector to the current time. Takes 2 values: `True` or `False`.

CVE_PULL_HISTORY.description: If set to `True`, import all CVEs from start year define in history start year configuration and history start year is required. Takes 2 values: `True` or `False`.

CVE_HISTORY_START_YEAR.description: Year in number. Required when pull_history is set to `True`.  Minimum 2019 as CVSS V3.1 was released in June 2019, thus most CVE published before 2019 do not include the cvssMetricV31 object.

CVE_API_KEY.description: API Key for the CVE API.

contracts.title: ServiceNow connector
contracts.description: ServiceNow provides Security Incident Response and Security Incident Tasks module handled by this connector which collects SIR and SIT and related entities.
contracts.short_description: Ingestion of SIR and SIT as Case Incident and Tasks.

OPENCTI_TOKEN.description: The token of the user who represents the connector in the OpenCTI platform.

CONNECTOR_TYPE.description: Should always be set to EXTERNAL_IMPORT for this connector.

CONNECTOR_SCOPE.description: The scope or type of data the connector is importing, either a MIME type or Stix Object (for information only).

CONNECTOR_LOG_LEVEL.description: Determines the verbosity of the logs.

CONNECTOR_DURATION_PERIOD.description: Duration between two scheduled runs of the connector (ISO 8601 format).

CONNECTOR_ID.description: A unique UUIDv4 identifier for this connector instance.

CONNECTOR_QUEUE_THRESHOLD.description: Connector queue max size in Mbytes. Default to 500.

SERVICENOW_API_VERSION.description: ServiceNow API version used for REST requests.

SERVICENOW_API_LEAKY_BUCKET_RATE.description: Bucket refill rate (in tokens per second). Controls the rate at which API calls are allowed. For example, a rate of 10 means that 10 calls can be made per second, if the bucket is not empty.

SERVICENOW_API_LEAKY_BUCKET_CAPACITY.description: Maximum bucket capacity (in tokens). Defines the number of calls that can be made immediately in a burst. Once the bucket is empty, it refills at the rate defined by 'api_leaky_bucket_rate'.

SERVICENOW_API_RETRY.description: Maximum number of retry attempts in case of API failure.

SERVICENOW_API_BACKOFF.description: Exponential backoff duration between API retries (ISO 8601 duration format).

SERVICENOW_IMPORT_START_DATE.description: Start date of first import (ISO date format).

SERVICENOW_TLP_LEVEL.description: Traffic Light Protocol (TLP) level to apply on objects imported into OpenCTI.

SERVICENOW_OBSERVABLES_DEFAULT_SCORE.description: Allows you to define a default score for observables and indicators when the 'promote_observables_as_indicators' variable is set to True.

SERVICENOW_PROMOTE_OBSERVABLES_AS_INDICA.description: Boolean to promote observables into indicators.

SERVICENOW_INSTANCE_NAME.description: Corresponds to server instance name (will be used for API requests).

SERVICENOW_API_KEY.description: Secure identifier used to validate access to ServiceNow APIs.

SERVICENOW_STATE_TO_EXCLUDE.description: List of security incident states to exclude from import.

SERVICENOW_SEVERITY_TO_EXCLUDE.description: List of security incident severities to exclude from import.

SERVICENOW_PRIORITY_TO_EXCLUDE.description: List of security incident priorities to exclude from import.

SERVICENOW_COMMENT_TO_EXCLUDE.description: List of comment types to exclude: private, public, auto

contracts.title: IpInfo connector
contracts.description: Accurate IP address data that keeps pace with secure, specific, and forward-looking use cases

OPENCTI_TOKEN.description: The token of the user who represents the connector in the OpenCTI platform.

CONNECTOR_TYPE.description: Should always be set to INTERNAL_ENRICHMENT for this connector.

CONNECTOR_SCOPE.description: The scope or type of data the connector is importing, either a MIME type or Stix Object (for information only).

CONNECTOR_LOG_LEVEL.description: Determines the verbosity of the logs.

CONNECTOR_AUTO.description: Enables or disables automatic enrichment of observables for OpenCTI.

CONNECTOR_ID.description: A unique UUIDv4 identifier for this connector instance.

IPINFO_MAX_TLP.description: Traffic Light Protocol (TLP) level to apply on objects imported into OpenCTI.

IPINFO_USE_ASN_NAME.description: If enabled, uses the ASN name instead of the ASN number in enrichment results.

IPINFO_TOKEN.description: API token used to authenticate requests to the IPInfo service.
